author: vishady
content: hi! i was curious--when you hit the `/lobby/try_contribute` endpoint and the sequencer is ready for the user to contribute, what is stopping the user from sending the previous transcript back with the request body of `/contribute`?

author: vishady
content: to clarify, could a potential bad actor update the transcript by claiming that their entropy is the identity?

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> A bad actor can just contribute any entropy (including the identity) and publish it. This is not an attack vector

author: bridge-bot
content: <dankrad> such a contribution does not increase the security of the setup but it also doesn't decrease it. The security is based on there being at least one contribution which destroyed the entropy irrevocably, and having some people contribute with trivial entropy (which you cannot prevent) does nothing to reduce security other than crowding out honest contributors

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> yup, only the point at infinity is not allowed
